title: How long does it take to produce an audiobook? - Quora

response.answer_text: The first thing I have to do is read the entire book before I begin any recording. This is called "prep". Once I start recording, it takes 1 day for every 2 hours of audio to do the initial recording. So if a book is 10 hours long, I can have the initial recording done in a week. Then a proofer goes through and listens for any mistakes, noises, and audio that doesn't match the text. I'll need a day to fix any mistakes that person finds. Then another day to master it (EQ, compression, other technical things). I can have a 10 hour book done and ready for audible in about 8 days, give or take.

It took about 5 weeks for me to get a copy recorded that I could upload to Audible. And it cost $1,000, it was for my 4 1/2 hour book (about 200 pages). They did a good job. I wish I had recorded it with my own voice, but I did not have the time and could not find an easy way to do it. Michael L. F. Slavin Author of One Million in the Bank: How to Make $1,000,000 With Your Own Business, Even If You Have No Money Or Experience www.onemillioninthebank.com
